item.title: Israel-Lebanon tensions high after Golan hit, US urges calm
How a flaming car led to one of biggest fires in California's history
item.description: The Park Fire in the Sierra Nevada foothills, potentially sparked by an act of arson involving a flaming car pushed into a ravine, has rapidly grown to become California’s sixth-largest fire. This rapid expansion was due to several factors that had been building over the years. Two consecutive wet winters resulted in abundant grass and brush growth, which was then dried out by summer heatwaves, creating ideal fire conditions.

item.title: 'Ahem Google!': Kamala Harris headlines in Trump searches? What Elon Musk said
item.description: Elon Musk criticized Google for showing Kamala Harris in search results when users searched for Donald Trump. He suggested Google might be censoring Trump-related news ahead of the US elections. Musk also shared user posts claiming Google's positive bias towards censorship. In response, Google stated no manual actions were taken to alter search results.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea seeks medicines for Kim Jong Un's health problems: Seoul

item.title: Failed North Korea satellite launch engine points to Russian role, say South Korean lawmakers
item.description: The NIS informed lawmakers that there were no signs North Korea had developed the liquid oxygen and kerosene engine. Lee Seong-kweun, a member of the parliamentary intelligence committee, stated, "Given that liquid oxygen and kerosene were used in the engine for the first time, they had likely received Russian support."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I am very open-minded but ... ': Why Trump called Paris Olympics opening ceremony a 'disgrace'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Internet thinks JD Vance wears eyeliner, makeup artist says 'possible'
item.description: JD Vance's eye makeup is one thing people are searching on the internet with videos on how to create smoky eyes like JD Vance going viral on TikTok. Social media users are convinced that JD Vance uses some kind of eye make up, including an eyeliner, to accentuate his blue eyes for the camera.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Trump gunman was seen 90 mins before shooting'
item.description: Thomas Crooks, who attempted to kill Donald Trump on July 13, was identified by police over an hour before the shooting. FBI's Kevin Rojek stated that officers spotted Crooks using a range finder and browsing news sites. Moments later, Crooks fired eight rounds before being neutralized. Trump will give a victim's interview to provide his perspective.

item.title: FDA approves blood test method for colon cancer screening
item.description: The FDA approved Guardant Health's Shield blood test for colon cancer screening, making it likely to be covered by Medicare and private insurers. It is effective at detecting later-stage cancers but not early-stage polyps. A positive result requires follow-up with a colonoscopy. Doctors see potential for increased screening rates, but its impact on reducing mortality remains to be seen.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ex-wife of Kamala Harris husband now slams Megyn Kelly: 'WTF is this'
item.description: ​Douglas Emhoff's first wife Kerstin Emhoff is all there for Kamala Harris. She shielded her where she was attacked for being childless and said her two children were co-parented by Kamala after Kamala and her ex-husband married. Now she has hit out at journalist Megyn Kelly as Megyn said Kamala supports "sterilization and mutilation of perfectly healthy minor children".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iowa latest to adopt near-total abortion ban
'Feathers ruffled seeing queerness...': French drag queen shuts down criticism over Olympics opening ceremony
item.description: Amid severe criticism across the world that the opening ceremony of the Olympics in Paris insulted the Christianity, French drag queen Nicky Dolly took to social media and said that there was a reason the opening ceremony ruffled some feathers. "Because the Olympics are the biggest stage in the world and us queer people have always been the audience of other people's life and achievement and it is the time that we are welcome in the space," Nicky wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rushdie endorses Harris for US prez run
Edna O'Brien, Irish literary giant who wrote 'The Country Girls', dies
item.description: Edna O'Brien, the notable Irish author, died at 93 after a long illness. Known for her debut novel 'The Country Girls,' which scandalised Ireland in 1960, she authored over 20 books that challenged societal norms. O'Brien received significant recognition, including an Irish Book Award for lifetime achievement and the PEN/Nabokov prize.

item.title: Soldier among 2 dead in clashes at port city Gwadar
Joe Biden unveils plan for SC term limits, ethics code
JD Vance says he's not hurt by 'weird' campaign: 'If you can't take the heat...'
item.description: ​“Look, the price of admission — meaning, the price of getting to serve the people of this country — is the Democrats are going to attack us with everything that they have. I think it’s an honor,” Vance said citing Harry Truman that "if you can't take the heat, stay out of the kitchen".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
